29#ifndef ISCCC_UTIL_H
30#define ISCCC_UTIL_H 1
31
32#include <inttypes.h>
33
34#include <isc/util.h>
35
36/*! \file isccc/util.h
37 * \brief
38 * Macros for dealing with unaligned numbers.
39 *
40 * \note no side effects are allowed when invoking these macros!
41 */
42
43#define GET8(v, w) \
44 do { \
45 v = *w; \
46 w++; \
47 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
48
49#define GET16(v, w) \
50 do { \
51 v = (unsigned int)w[0] << 8; \
52 v |= (unsigned int)w[1]; \
53 w += 2; \
54 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
55
56#define GET24(v, w) \
57 do { \
58 v = (unsigned int)w[0] << 16; \
59 v |= (unsigned int)w[1] << 8; \
60 v |= (unsigned int)w[2]; \
61 w += 3; \
62 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
63
64#define GET32(v, w) \
65 do { \
66 v = (unsigned int)w[0] << 24; \
67 v |= (unsigned int)w[1] << 16; \
68 v |= (unsigned int)w[2] << 8; \
69 v |= (unsigned int)w[3]; \
70 w += 4; \
71 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
72
73#define GET64(v, w) \
74 do { \
75 v = (uint64_t)w[0] << 56; \
76 v |= (uint64_t)w[1] << 48; \
77 v |= (uint64_t)w[2] << 40; \
78 v |= (uint64_t)w[3] << 32; \
79 v |= (uint64_t)w[4] << 24; \
80 v |= (uint64_t)w[5] << 16; \
81 v |= (uint64_t)w[6] << 8; \
82 v |= (uint64_t)w[7]; \
83 w += 8; \
84 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
85
86#define GETC16(v, w, d) \
87 do { \
88 GET8(v, w); \
89 if (v == 0) \
90 d = ISCCC_TRUE; \
91 else { \
92 d = ISCCC_FALSE; \
93 if (v == 255) \
94 GET16(v, w); \
95 } \
96 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
97
98#define GETC32(v, w) \
99 do { \
100 GET24(v, w); \
101 if (v == 0xffffffu) \
102 GET32(v, w); \
103 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
104
105#define GET_OFFSET(v, w) GET32(v, w)
106
107#define GET_MEM(v, c, w) \
108 do { \
109 memmove(v, w, c); \
110 w += c; \
111 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
112
113#define GET_TYPE(v, w) \
114 do { \
115 GET8(v, w); \
116 if (v > 127) { \
117 if (v < 255) \
118 v = ((v & 0x7f) << 16) | ISCCC_RDATATYPE_SIG; \
119 else \
120 GET32(v, w); \
121 } \
122 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
123
124#define PUT8(v, w) \
125 do { \
126 *w = (v & 0x000000ffU); \
127 w++; \
128 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
129
130#define PUT16(v, w) \
131 do { \
132 w[0] = (v & 0x0000ff00U) >> 8; \
133 w[1] = (v & 0x000000ffU); \
134 w += 2; \
135 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
136
137#define PUT24(v, w) \
138 do { \
139 w[0] = (v & 0x00ff0000U) >> 16; \
140 w[1] = (v & 0x0000ff00U) >> 8; \
141 w[2] = (v & 0x000000ffU); \
142 w += 3; \
143 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
144
145#define PUT32(v, w) \
146 do { \
147 w[0] = (v & 0xff000000U) >> 24; \
148 w[1] = (v & 0x00ff0000U) >> 16; \
149 w[2] = (v & 0x0000ff00U) >> 8; \
150 w[3] = (v & 0x000000ffU); \
151 w += 4; \
152 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
153
154#define PUT64(v, w) \
155 do { \
156 w[0] = (v & 0xff00000000000000ULL) >> 56; \
157 w[1] = (v & 0x00ff000000000000ULL) >> 48; \
158 w[2] = (v & 0x0000ff0000000000ULL) >> 40; \
159 w[3] = (v & 0x000000ff00000000ULL) >> 32; \
160 w[4] = (v & 0x00000000ff000000ULL) >> 24; \
161 w[5] = (v & 0x0000000000ff0000ULL) >> 16; \
162 w[6] = (v & 0x000000000000ff00ULL) >> 8; \
163 w[7] = (v & 0x00000000000000ffULL); \
164 w += 8; \
165 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
166
167#define PUTC16(v, w) \
168 do { \
169 if (v > 0 && v < 255) \
170 PUT8(v, w); \
171 else { \
172 PUT8(255, w); \
173 PUT16(v, w); \
174 } \
175 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
176
177#define PUTC32(v, w) \
178 do { \
179 if (v < 0xffffffU) \
180 PUT24(v, w); \
181 else { \
182 PUT24(0xffffffU, w); \
183 PUT32(v, w); \
184 } \
185 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
186
187#define PUT_OFFSET(v, w) PUT32(v, w)
188
189#include <string.h>
190
191#define PUT_MEM(s, c, w) \
192 do { \
193 memmove(w, s, c); \
194 w += c; \
195 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
196
197/*
198 * Regions.
199 */
200#define REGION_SIZE(r) ((unsigned int)((r).rend - (r).rstart))
201#define REGION_EMPTY(r) ((r).rstart == (r).rend)
202#define REGION_FROMSTRING(r, s) do { \
203 (r).rstart = (unsigned char *)s; \
204 (r).rend = (r).rstart + strlen(s); \
205} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
206
207/*%
208 * Use this to remove the const qualifier of a variable to assign it to
209 * a non-const variable or pass it as a non-const function argument ...
210 * but only when you are sure it won't then be changed!
211 * This is necessary to sometimes shut up some compilers
212 * (as with gcc -Wcast-qual) when there is just no other good way to avoid the
213 * situation.
214 */
215#define DE_CONST(konst, var) \
216 do { \
217 union { const void *k; void *v; } _u; \
218 _u.k = konst; \
219 var = _u.v; \
220 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
221
222#endif /* ISCCC_UTIL_H */
223
